intro: Galactia whitehornii, commonly known as the whitehorn milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial species belonging to the Fabaceae family, known for its compound leaves and showy, pea-like flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, typical of the legume family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Galactia whitehornii is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its potential in traditional herbal medicine.
